channel.title: how-to on Martin Rydén's PhD Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content in how-to on Martin Rydén's PhD Portfolio

item.title: The Quiz (Part 2)
item.description: Now that we have gathered our knowledgebase, it is time to quiz ourselves on our knowledge. library(tidyverse) # For data transformation / reshaping library(data.table) # For data transformation / reshaping library(rvest) # For web scraping wikitable <- fread("wikitable.tsv") # Function to clean sentences by removing some non-alphanumeric characters and removing if it's a "common" word clean <- function(dat){ dat %>% tolower() %>% strsplit(split = " ") %>% unlist() %>% gsub("[[:punct:]]", "", .

item.title: The Quiz (Part 1)
item.description: Preface Imagine for a moment that you are interested in knowing the molecular function of some well-studied extracellular matrix proteins (don’t leave yet). Some would suggest that we’d find out by simply opening a book. Others would argue that we should simply open Rstudio. But how will we put our knowledge to the test? The answer – is with a quiz. Objective Given a list of protein names, describe their molecular function using a data-mining approach.

item.title: R programming tips
item.description: 1.0 Rstudio tips 1.1 Keyboard Shortcuts 1.2 Snippets 1.3 Cheatsheets 2.0 Code formatting 2.1 Comments Reshaping data Long to Wide 1.0 Rstudio tips Rstudio is a powerful IDE. Study these not-so-obvious tips on how to realize its true potential. 1.1 Keyboard Shortcuts Some information Ctrl + Shift + m gives %>% 1.2 Snippets Snippets are predefined blocks of code that are used to quickly insert a function.

item.title: How I made this blog
item.description: Github Create a new Github repository (or Github pages repo by naming it username.github.io) Check “Initialize this repository with a README” Add a license Clone your repo to your home dir: cd git clone https://github.com/martinry/martinry.github.io.git cd martinry.github.io Install Hugo Mac: brew install hugo Linux: sudo apt-get install hugo Create a new Hugo project # New project hugo new site ./ --force # --force to write to existing dir # Add a theme git submodule add https://github.
